intro: Troximon nuttallii, commonly known as the Nuttall's troximon, is a species of flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its botanical structure includes a slender stem, aromatic foliage, and a root system adapted to withstand drought conditions.
